group_siblings.title: [The Flying potato]
group_siblings.creator_credit: Tarnagulla and Marong Primary Schools and Paul Fletcher

results.title: First Touch
results.brief_description: Using archival films of the Apollo lunar missions in the late 1960s and early 70s, this 2 screen video installation contemplates humankind’s first touch of the moon. Often considered a giant leap in human development, the video concentrates on the delicate and hesitant movements of the astronauts and their spaceships as they overcome the limits of outer space. With both humour and melancholy, stunning images of the moon, the earth, and the astronauts and their spacecraft, are interwoven into a wondrous contemplation of this extraordinary achievement.

results.title: End Game
results.creator_credit: Michael Fairlie, Emma Crimmings and Rhys Graham
results.brief_description: Using the fragments, clock leaders and strips of films found at the beginning and end of hundreds of old 16mm films, this Public Imaging work explores the visual beauty of the film’s surface. Concealed among ACMI’s vast film collection, these pieces of film are a testament to the aging wonder of celluloid. The play of light and colour that can be found in the interweaving of these accidents and offcuts makes for a hypnotic experience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Fairlie, Emma Crimmings and Rhys Graham

results.title: Ron's story
results.creator_credit: Davide Grassi, Boris Greguric, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey
results.brief_description: Ron’s Story is a video based on the work and obsessions of Los Angeles-based extreme performance artist Ron Athey. The video is comprised of footage filmed at various performances staged at the Kapelica Gallery and the Cultural Centre Cankarjev dom in Ljubljana between 1996 and 2001.

results.title: Blue
results.creator_credit: Curtis Wehrfritz, Michael Pacek, Bruce McDonald and Don McKellar
results.brief_description: Canadian horror director David Cronenberg puts in an impressive performance as a bored carpert factory executive whose daily routine involves minor flirtations with his secretary and cronic masturbation in the privacy of his office. This explicit and ultimately melancholy tale of pornography and loneliness is intercut with a 1960s era stag loop called ‘The bellboy and the bored housewife’ and features the film’s star reminiscing about her experiences in the sex trade.

results.title: Bush mechanics
results.creator_credit: CAAMA, Indigenous Unit, AFC, Warlpiri Media, Tom Kantor, David Nixon, Francis Kelly and David Batty
results.brief_description:
A documentary that takes a light-hearted look at the ingenious methods that Aboriginal men living in remote communities employ to keep their automobiles running. Without a trade certificate between them, these men have developed the unique craft of ‘bush mechanics’ adapting
available resources for use as spare parts. The stories they relate provide an unique insight into this practical and philosophical approach to car maintenance and highlight many of the adaptive techniques desert people have developed through necessity over the last seventy years. This documentary spawned a television series produced by
the Australian Broadcasting Commission in association with Warlpiri Media. For more information go to: http://www.warlpiri.com.au/bushmechanics/bushmech.htm

results.title: The Hitch
results.creator_credit: Luke Doolan, Damon Herriman and Michael Booth
results.brief_description:
A driver picks up a hitchhiker on a deserted country road but it seems neither of them knows what lies ahead.

‘The Hitch’ was shot over 6 days in the outer suburbs of Sydney, Australia. Almost all cast and crew donated their time. The budget was approximately $20,000.

results.title: The French doors
results.creator_credit: Sam Brunette, Liz Garneau and Steve Ayson
results.brief_description: A man is renovating his home and adds a set of French doors to the house. When he wakes the next morning the world has taken a dramatic turn into the unknown.

results.title: 15' Zondergrond = 15' Metromania = 15 Metromania
results.creator_credit: Bert Hamelinck, Karl Huysmans and Bart Van den Bempt
results.brief_description: Bernd is the new security guard at the Metro underground. Just as he relaxes into the position, a stern boss dictates some impossible rules and young Bernd’s day goes from bad to worse. Drawing on the aesthetic of the surveillance industry, director Bart Van den Bempt parallels surveillance type images alongside the running plot with split screens. As Bernd, infatuation by a young woman, tracks her movements using the security cameras, we the audience tour the process of security camera surveillance. The film style and structure become bound to the processes of surveillance, whilst the process of surveillance informs the film structure (specifically the narrative and the editing style).
